website_summaries.verdict: A terrific survival machete that is crafted in the United States.
pros: Comes with a heavy-duty nylon sheath that enables you to protect the machete against the elements
First-rate machete works great for chopping or splitting wood
Well-constructed in comparison to similar machetes
cons: More expensive than many comparable options
Machete's blade may need to be sharpened right out of the box

customer_reviews.title: Bad and Heavy.
customer_reviews.text: This is a machete for thick, hard bushes and trees. It can also be used as an ax. My skinny arthritic hands and wrists are not able to put this puppy to the test but, the more I use it, the stronger I get, so........I got that goin' for me........
customer_reviews.author: Edward

customer_reviews.title: Different sheath??
customer_reviews.text: Lives up to everything you'll hear, this thing's a beast. That being said OKC is apparently no longer shipping it with the nice leather sheath and has instead started using the crappy nylon sheaths you always see from them... kinda disappointed but I don't plan on wearing it much so no big deal. Still worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Adam Corbin

customer_reviews.title: Great tool! Awesome for splitting and chopping wood
customer_reviews.text: Great tool! Awesome for splitting and chopping wood...it says "survival machete" but I wouldn't use this to clear shrubs or brush it doesn't have the right blade profile for it plus it heavy...but if you want a pry bar with an edge look no further!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua steele

customer_reviews.title: GREAT MACHETE (Get a better sheath)
customer_reviews.text: Still my favorite outdoors and survival tool But they now come with a lame sheath and plastic insert. I tried to remove the insert and it ripped the fabric. If I can tear it with my hand strength it will definitely not last with outdoor use. This is my third sp8, the first one was Used hard outdoors for an entire year before my friend asked for it (it was still in remakable condition) i still have the second, and want this another one for my other leg. I am going to see if i can buy just the sheath somewhere
customer_reviews.author: Hassan

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: I've had an Ontario fixed blade knife that I've used on camping and hunting trips for 20+ years and it has held up wonderfully. This survival machete is of the same quality. Very strong built. My only gripes are that it came fairly dull. And the saw teeth could be better used if they were facing the other way. The saw teeth on the back of the blade are so thick that it is very hard to push away from you and still push hard enough to saw anything. However I bought it for its prying/chopping capabilities and not so much as a saw. All in all it's a good item for the money
customer_reviews.author: John m.f. Doe

customer_reviews.title: I’m very pleased with this machete. A great bush craft tool.
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t tried using this yet but it looks great. Well made. Stong and sharp. Received many recommendations on utube and looked impressive when they demonstrated using it. Expect this will be an excellent machete for bush craft, especially with cutting up firewood and building shelters. Nice size for anyone to use. Feels comfortable in my hand.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: it chopped great for what I was using it for I like ...
customer_reviews.text: it chopped great for what I was using it for I like the weight and how it feels in my hands very comfortable good product
customer_reviews.author: charles haley

customer_reviews.title: Great Fixed Blade
customer_reviews.text: Great weight and sturdy built product that I use now exclusively for my b.o.b. backpacks. Nice sheaths as well. The blade is sharp and keeps an edge, but also easy to sharpen too. They are long enough to use for brush clearing but also small enough to use when camp cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Better than a hatchet
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! I bought this instead of a hatchet and it has so much more utility.
customer_reviews.author: Meghan Demorest

customer_reviews.title: Not a chopper
customer_reviews.text: From what I can tell, this is more of a pry bar rather than a chopping knife. The blade is fairly flexible, so if it is used for chopping wood, the knife vibrates and causes blisters on the hand if used without a glove. It works okay for batoning wood, but I prefer an Ontario SP10 or some other knife for batoning. Works well for prying.
customer_reviews.author: Toshiyasu Morita

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Functional
customer_reviews.text: As fine as I recall my husband's too-long-gone SP-8 was. It's a functional piece of homesteading and brush clearing equipment that's as fine as his Lee Valley Stainless Steel Spade and Century old Chameleon Hand Cultivator. I expect it'll last longer than he will!
customer_reviews.author: Rayna

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: More of a combat machete than a survival machete, it'll get the job done and will most certainly outlast it's owner.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Houllis

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second SP8 love it just as much as the first. It's strong and can take a lot of abuse. I've got one in my pack and one in my car.
customer_reviews.author: rotaxtwin

customer_reviews.title: Does what it’s supposed to
customer_reviews.text: Hard to compare to other machetes since this is our first but it’s very durable and well made. We use it to chop wood, some types are easier to chop than others. Mainly chose it for the size, it’s not too big. Cool sheath comes with it that’s easy to attached to your belt.
customer_reviews.author: Angelina

customer_reviews.title: WOW!  A must have for the campers \ preppers.
customer_reviews.text: This knife is a beast. I use it now as my primary HD chopper. I think it could literally chop a arm off if used for self defense.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: A BEST BUY
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for emergencies. Heavy duty. I keep it in my truck. A good piece of gear.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Damaged Packaging
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for myself. Glad it was not a gift. The brown Amazon box was pristine , however the box the knife was in looked liked it had been walked on. The knife appears to be sound. I have purchased several Ontario knives and will continue to do so. More care could be used in handling packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Jarrett

customer_reviews.title: As Described
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my hub. He’s really happy with it. Nice quality.
customer_reviews.author: shoremama

customer_reviews.title: Best machete i've ever seen
customer_reviews.text: Best machete i've ever seen. Also works for splitting wood. My boss had me order him one after seeing mine.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived quickly and as described. Good quality packable machete with plenty of backbone. It is a little heavy but I like the weight.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for show & tell, but not functional
customer_reviews.text: Although I am impressed with the robust construction, adequate sheath and blade sharpness, this is a very clumsy & unbalanced knife that feels awkward to use. It appears to have the genetics of a machete, butcher knife and hatchet. I have yet to figure out the specific application where this knife would be most useful. It's too short and heavy to swing like a machete. You can't really saw with it because the teeth are dull. Hard to chop with it because it's so top-heavy. Can't really classify it as a survival weapon. Pun intended, but there's really no point to this knife!
customer_reviews.author: V-Tran

customer_reviews.title: Amazing quality + affordable price
customer_reviews.text: I've put it off long enough, my biggest regret is that it no longer comes with the drop leg sheath. The sp8 by itself is great. Everything I expected it would be. Unfortunately, these new sheaths are only good for pack carrying.
customer_reviews.author: Kentucky raider

customer_reviews.title: Amazing tool...Garbage sheath!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing all around tool. I have used one for years, for everything outdoors. From camping to yardwork. I bought a few for christmas to give to family members. One of then came with a crappy nylon sheath. Is this the new style sheath? This sheath is junk. Ontario should go back to the old leather sheath. It's very sturdy and belongs with this amazing tool. With the old sheath, I give it 5 stars. With this new style garbage "carry system" I give it 3 stars. Ontario...step it up and put your tool back in the leather sheath it belongs in.
customer_reviews.author: DR

customer_reviews.title: I did have the spine teeth grinded down flat (it was eating up my botoning wood) after that it was AMAZING. The Ka-bar Large Heavy Bowie was my go ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the Ontario Sp-8 Survival "Knife" in 2012 and have BEAT THE BAHEACKLES out of it battoning big wood. I did have the spine teeth grinded down flat (it was eating up my botoning wood) after that it was AMAZING. The Ka-bar Large Heavy Bowie was my go to Battoning knife (Discontinued Unfortunately) but the Ontario Sp-8 did the jobs nothing else could it's a chunck of 1095 Steel that will bust through anything it's full tang and just awesome. I do suggest having it customized about $20.00 having the spine grounded down.
customer_reviews.author: spiritartman

customer_reviews.title: Skookum Chopper
customer_reviews.text: First thing was to convex the edge. Cleanly cuts paper now. Next was to open up a grip point for two fingers in front of the handle. Lastly to grind off the silly saw teeth. Keep it waxed with a sticky wax.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Siddens

product_meta.title: Ontario Knife Company 8683 SP8 Machete Survival 10" Sawback Blade, Cordura and Leather Sheath
product_meta.description: Spec plus Series knives are designed for military, sporting and rescue use. The spec plus products are a diverse mix of top-selling and innovative knife and tool patterns designed for military, sporting and first responder purposes. Each knife in the spec plus Series features a comfortable Kraton handle, epoxy textured powder coated 1095 carbon steel blades, full tang construction and a tactical sheath. Specifications: - overall length: 15.20" - lock type: fixed - hardness: 57-59 HRc - edge type: Plain - handle color: black - blade grind: flat bevel with secondary flat bevel - blade finish: powder coat - blade color: black - blade thickness: 0.250" - blade material: 1095 carbon steel - blade length: 10" - handle material: Kraton - sheath material: leather cordura - sheath color: black - sheath type: belt loop
feature_bullets: Blade grind: flat bevel with secondary flat bevel

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
